metadata.Title: CVE-2020-20445 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
FFmpeg 4.2 is affected by a Divide By Zero issue via libavcodec/lpc.h,which allows a remote malicious user to cause a Denial of Service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-20445` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavdevice58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter7 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat-extra58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavutil56 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libpostproc55 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libswresample3 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libswscale5 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2').
